p: Further analyses showed that the most important predictor of knowledge subscale was the level of education (β = −0.107), explaining 10.7% of the variance, followed by age (β = −0.081, 8.1%) ( R 2 = 0.27, Adj. R 2 = 0.21, F = 4.43, t = 10.37, p < 0.01). This model (with all mentioned independent variables) explains the 21% variance of knowledge. The remaining variables did not have a significant impact on knowledge ( Table 2).
